etymologies: early 18th century; earliest use found in Boston Selectman. From engine + man

definitions: A person (especially a man) who operates, or assists with the operation of, a fire engine.
A person (especially a man) who operates or attends to a stationary engine (especially a steam engine) in a factory, mine, etc. Now rare (chiefly historical).
The operator of a locomotive engine; a train driver.

notes.text: Chiefly, and in early use only, with reference to steam-powered locomotives.
